column15: 'COMBINED SYNOPSIS/SOLICITATION\nThis is a combined synopsis/solicitation
column16: which is expected to result in an award of a “Firm-Fixed Price” contract for a commercial item
column17: i.e.
column18: Simlab Audio Visual Simulator.  The combined synopsis/solicitation is prepared IAW the procedures in the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) Subpart 12.6
column19: as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; quotes are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued.  This synopsis/solicitation is conducted as a commercial item procurement using Simplified Acquisition Procedures (FAR Part 13).  An award
column21: will be made to the responsible offeror who submits a quote that (1) conforms to the requirements of the synopsis/solicitation; (2) that receives a rating of “Acceptable” on the Technical Capability evaluation factor; and (3) that submits the quote with the lowest total evaluated price (TEP)
column22:
provided that the TEP is not unbalanced and is determined to be fair and reasonable.  The Government reserves the right to award without discussions or to make no award at all depending upon (1) the quality of quotes received and (2) whether proposed prices are determined to be fair and reasonable. 
1. The solicitation number is FM485201350050.  This solicitation is issued as a Request for Quote (RFQ).
2. This requirement is solicited 100% Small-Business set-aside.
3. Below is the contract line item number (CLIN).
CLIN 0001 – One (1) Simlab Audio Visual Simulator
4. Description of requirement for the item to be acquired:       
            Attachment 1 – Requirement Description 
5. Delivery Date:  30 Days ARO
6. Delivery/Ship to Location:  Nellis AFB
column23: NV\n7. Inspection and acceptance:  FOB destination\n8. The incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular (FAC) 2020-06
column24: effective 06 May 2020.  The provisions and clauses included
column26:
are applicable to this solicitation.

column37: prospective vendors must be registered in the System for Award Management (SAM) database prior to contract award.  Lack of SAM registration shall be a determining factor for contract award.  Prospective vendors should visit the SAM website at http://www.sam.gov.com to register.\nSITE VISIT.  A site visit will be conducted on Friday
column38: 26 June 2020 at 11:00 A.M. PST at the Mike O’Callaghan Military Medical Center
column39: 4700 Las Vegas Blvd. North
column40: Bldg. 1300 Room L436
column41: Nellis AFB
column42: NV 89191.  Interested vendors must RSVP via email for additional information.  Vendors will need to bring a valid driver’s license
column43: proof of insurance
column44: vehicle registration
column45: and a face mask to be permitted onto base.  Email 2d Lt Kevin Sargent at kevin.sargent.7@us.af.mil to RSVP.  RSVP’s need to be made via email no later than COB Wednesday
column46: 24 June 2020.  Vendors will meet at the Nellis AFB Area 2 gate at 10:00 A.M PST on Friday
column47: 26 June 2020.  Vendors who fail to RSVP or arrive after the prescribed meeting time will not be permitted to attend. \nQUESTIONS AND ANSWERS.  All questions must be submitted via email to 2d Lt Kevin Sargent at kevin.sargent.7@us.af.mil.  Question emails need to include the solicitation number (FM485201350050) in the subject line.  Emails that do not include the solicitation number in the subject line will be considered spam and will not be reviewed.  The deadline for submitting questions is no later than Wednesday
column48: 1 July 2020 at 10:00 A.M. PST.  Questions submitted after the aforementioned cutoff date will not be reviewed or answered.  Answers will be provided no later than Friday
column49: 3 July 2020 at 4:30 P.M. PST.\nOFFER DUE DATE. Offers are due no later than Wednesday
column50:
8 July 2020 at 10:00 A.M. PST.  Only electronic offers submitted via e-mail will be considered for this requirement.  Submit offers to 2d Lt Kevin Sargent at kevin.sargent.7@us.af.mil.  Submission emails need to include the solicitation number (FM485201350050) in the subject line.  Emails that do not include the solicitation number in the subject line will be considered spam and will not be reviewed.  Early submission of quotes is encouraged.  The preferred document type is Portable Document Format (PDF). 
(End of Provision)
FAR 52.212-2 – Evaluation – Commercial Items (Oct 2014).
The Government will award a contract resulting from this solicitation to the responsible offeror whose offer is the lowest price
column51:
technically acceptable.  This is an “all or none” requirement and will be awarded on one contract.  Multiple contracts will not be issued.  Vendors who do not quote the entire package requested will be considered non-responsive and their quote will not be evaluated.
Technical Capability Ratings
Rating                               Description
Acceptable
Offer has provided all items listed in 52.212-1. The offeror’s quote clearly meets the requirements of the Solicitation and Attachment 1 – Requirement Description.
Unacceptable
Offer has not provided all items listed in 52.212-1. The offeror’s quote does not clearly meet the requirements of the Solicitation and Attachment 1 – Requirement Description.
A written notice of award or acceptance of an offer
column52: mailed or otherwise furnished to the successful offeror within the time for acceptance specified in the offer
column53: shall result in a binding contract without further action by either party. Before the offer’s specified expiration time
column54: the Government may accept an offer (or part of an offer)
column55: whether or not there are negotiations after its receipt
column56:
unless a written notice of withdrawal is received before award.
(End of Provision)

52.219-1 Small Business Program Representations (Mar 2020).
(a) Definitions. As used in this provision-
     “Economically disadvantaged women-owned small business (EDWOSB) concern” means a small business concern that is at least 51 percent directly and unconditionally owned by
column242: and the management and daily business operations of which are controlled by
column243:
one or more women who are citizens of the United States and who are economically disadvantaged in accordance with 13 CFR part 127. It automatically qualifies as a women-owned small business concern eligible under the WOSB Program.
      Service-disabled veteran-owned small business concern-
           (1) Means a small business concern-
                (i) Not less than 51 percent of which is owned by one or more service-disabled veterans or
column244: in the case of any publicly owned business
column245: not less than 51 percent of the stock of which is owned by one or more service-disabled veterans; and\n                (ii) The management and daily business operations of which are controlled by one or more service-disabled veterans or
column246: in the case of a service-disabled veteran with permanent and severe disability
column247: the spouse or permanent caregiver of such veteran.\n           (2) “Service-disabled veteran” means a veteran
column249: with a disability that is service-connected
column250: as defined in 38 U.S.C.101(16).\n      Small business concern means a concern
column252: that is independently owned and operated
column253: not dominant in the field of operation in which it is bidding on Government contracts
column254: and qualified as a small business under the criteria in 13 CFR Part 121 and the size standard in paragraph (b) of this provision.\n      Small disadvantaged business concern
column256: means a small business concern under the size standard applicable to the acquisition
column257: that-\n           (1) Is at least 51 percent unconditionally and directly owned (as defined at 13 CFR 124.105) by-\n                (i) One or more socially disadvantaged (as defined at 13 CFR 124.103) and economically disadvantaged (as defined at 13 CFR 124.104) individuals who are citizens of the United States
column258: and\n                (ii) Each individual claiming economic disadvantage has a net worth not exceeding $750
column259:
000 after taking into account the applicable exclusions set forth at 13 CFR 124.104(c)(2); and
           (2) The management and daily business operations of which are controlled (as defined at 13 CFR 124.106) by individuals who meet the criteria in paragraphs (1)(i) and (ii) of this definition.
     “Veteran-owned small business concern” means a small business concern-
           (1) Not less than 51 percent of which is owned by one or more veterans (as defined at 38 U.S.C.101(2)) or
column260: in the case of any publicly owned business
column261:
not less than 51 percent of the stock of which is owned by one or more veterans; and
           (2) The management and daily business operations of which are controlled by one or more veterans.
     “Women-owned small business concern” means a small business concern-
           (1) That is at least 51 percent owned by one or more women; or
column262: in the case of any publicly owned business
column263: at least 51 percent of the stock of which is owned by one or more women; and\n           (2) Whose management and daily business operations are controlled by one or more women.\n     “Women-owned small business (WOSB) concern eligible under the WOSB Program” (in accordance with 13 CFR part 127)
column264: means a small business concern that is at least 51 percent directly and unconditionally owned by
column265: and the management and daily business operations of which are controlled by
column266:
one or more women who are citizens of the United States.
